Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Wait a minute -- there's Hal.  And his date.

Speaker: maggie
Dialogue: How do they look?

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Excuse me -- I know you're my salvation, and all -- do you think you could rescue us before your smoke break?

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Maybe you could tell me why I am rescuing you.

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Basically -- I've fallen down, and I can't get up...

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Rescue One -- have located helpless climber, please prepare idiot line for transport, over --

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Rescue One -- please remind me to tell you about the time I hauled your hero here down Mt. Huntington on my back, over --

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: This guy showing you a good time?

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Now, remember -- keep your arms and legs within the vehicle at all times --

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Fuck you --

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Ready?  Did he tell you about the time he almost made it up Everest?

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: He said you gave him a bad oxygen mask --

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Well, if he's bored you with that bullshit, then this has to be the best part of a bad date. Right?

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Ready?

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: Okay --

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: I can't --

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Yes you can.  You can do it. Don't look down.  The whole way across, don't look down. Look at me. Just keep looking at me -- and you'll be okay.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Sure?

Speaker: susan
Dialogue: Yeah.  I have always depended on the kindness of Rangers.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Hold on. I'm coming out to get you.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Keep looking at me. Hold on --

Speaker: stewardess
Dialogue: Take this.  Afraid of flying?

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Falling.

Speaker: rental agent
Dialogue: Midsize?

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Any size, any color, any model.

Speaker: rental agent
Dialogue: How long will you be needing it?

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Just under six hours.

Speaker: maggie
Dialogue: I knew you'd be coming by. Today.

Speaker: maggie
Dialogue: If you're in that much of a hurry, why don't you ride with me?

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: This is new...

Speaker: maggie
Dialogue: It's a thermal scope -- picks up body heat of lost hikers --

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Still find the dead ones the old fashioned way, I guess.

Speaker: maggie
Dialogue: You could have said goodbye.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: If I did, I'd have to listen to you tell me one more time that it wasn't my fault.

Speaker: maggie
Dialogue: You did everything right --

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: -- If I did everything right, Susan Collins would still be alive.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Do you really believe all that?  That it wasn't our fault?

Speaker: maggie
Dialogue: Yes. Yes, I do.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: I'm not sure what I wish more, Maggie. That you meant what you said, just now -- or that it were really true then.

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Maggie, where the hell have you been? I've got two climbers out --

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Brett and Evan are up there again to jump off the spur. Their wives called twice. I want you in the air and I want them found before the storm system moves in.  Now.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Christ. You're in charge of Rescue now?

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: There was a vacancy. Maybe you heard about it. The last guy lost his nerve and lit out of town.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Well, you're a better man than I am, Hal. Nothing rattles you.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Gabe! Long time, son -- why don't you come meet some of the new guys --

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Good idea. Say, Hal?  Why don't you come with me so we can show these rookies how to death-rig a woman properly?

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Take the Bronco to where you're going. I've already been. Then go back to wherever it is you like to hide. And stay there.

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: Tell Wright the San Francisco shipment is ready.

Speaker: david
Dialogue: Right away, Mr. Travers.

Speaker: wright
Dialogue: Good -- good. I'll be right down.

Speaker: matheson
Dialogue: Walter Wright?  Matheson. FBI. We need to talk.

Speaker: pilot
Dialogue: We'll be fueled and ready in ten minutes, Mr. Travers.

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: Be ready in five.

Speaker: matheson
Dialogue: Matheson. FBI.

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: What the fuck is this about?

Speaker: wright
Dialogue: Small problem with the shipment, Travers.  Tell him what you just told me.

Speaker: matheson
Dialogue: We got word that somebody's been observing your currency shipments -- this load, the $5,000s -- over the last three deliveries.

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: This is the most protected shipment we've got -- and the most useless for a thief. Those bills aren't in circulation. You think five thousand dollar bills are easy to pass? Who the fuck would try?

Speaker: matheson
Dialogue: This guy might.

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: Who is he?

Speaker: mathers
Dialogue: His name's Eric Qualen. One of the East German spies who got shut out by the reunification. The CIA issued an inter-agency warning about him right after the wall came down. He's got nowhere to go and nothing to lose. He's also got the international connections to get rid of bills like these -- and he's probably desperate enough to try for them. Fifty million bucks buys a lot of sanctuary.

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: Could you get to the part where I'm supposed to care?

Speaker: matheson
Dialogue: We had two agents monitoring him. These two -- Gleason and Quinones. Their last report said he was going to try to take this shipment.

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: Thanks for the tip. But I've got work to do.

Speaker: matheson
Dialogue: Did I say "last" report? I think I did. I mean last fucking report. These guys have vanished.

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: You have my sympathy, but --  There's a reason we do things this way, all right? Armored cars can be hijacked. Trains can be derailed. But nobody can get to us in flight. The only time this is on the ground is at the mint, or on the Presidio runway in San Francisco. Either way, someone would have to shoot his way past a couple of thousand guards.

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: If you're worried about an inside job, forget it. I checked the plane from top to bottom an hour ago. And these three are my best against. Even if one of them did go skydiving, they wouldn't get far. Each case has an electronic tracer with a range of one hundred miles.

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: I haven't lost a bill in eight years. And I'm not scrubbing this shipment because you scare easily.

Speaker: matheson
Dialogue: I've been tracking Qualen for almost a year. If he pulls something, I want to be in on the party.

Speaker: wright
Dialogue: This is cleared from the top, Travers. Matheson will accompany you on the flight to San Francisco.  Show him every professional courtesy.

Speaker: maggie
Dialogue: Rescue One to base, over.

Speaker: maggie
Dialogue: Negative, Hal -- storm's already moving in -- I can't see them, and winds are too strong to stay up here -- over --

Speaker: maggie
Dialogue: I don't think he's planning a long visit, Hal.  Rescue One heading back to base, over and out.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Way to check the weather, Brett.

Speaker: brett
Dialogue: Hey. If it were easy, it wouldn't be worth d-doing.

Speaker: agent
Dialogue: Just enjoy the view, huh?  Relax. I mean, what could happen in the air?

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: Stay put! Don't panic, goddammit!

Speaker: pilot
Dialogue: He's coming in too slow.

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: No -- we're going too fast, and we're too high up. Push flaps forward twenty degrees and drop to five thousand feet.

Speaker: matheson
Dialogue: You got any rifles?

Speaker: agent
Dialogue: Forward compartment -- left side --

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: What the hell are you doing --

Speaker: matheson
Dialogue: Checked the plane from top to bottom, huh? You fucker --  Put your hands behind your head! It's over!

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: Calm down -- give the gun to me --

Speaker: matheson
Dialogue: There's a couple of dead bodies in the front compartment -- they're FBI agents --

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: He's losing it --

Speaker: matheson
Dialogue: Goddamn it! Don't you see what he's doing! He's hijacking the fucking shipment!  Don't make me shoot you!

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: Don't make me laugh.

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: Move into position.

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: More -- more -- keep it coming --

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: Locked on. Move into lateral position.

Speaker: kristel
Dialogue: Moving into lateral position.

Speaker: pilot
Dialogue: We're right on the edge of the storm -- let's move it.

Speaker: pilot
Dialogue: This isn't going to work -- Wright will suspect something.

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: So what. He'll sift though a plane that went down in a storm --  -- and just enough of the right kind of ash.

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: We get twenty-one gun funerals and they write off fifty million. It's perfect, as long as you hold the plane steady -- so concentrate.

Speaker: qualen
Dialogue: Travers -- hurry it up.

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: On my way.

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: That charge is going to blow both engines -- the plane'll go down like a rock, so clip yourself on to the end of the cable with the money as soon as I get over.  And make sure you bring the right cases.

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: Dip the plane. I'm coming over.

Speaker: qualen
Dialogue: Why didn't you send the money over?

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: Somehow, I didn't think you'd have waited for me if I'd sent it first.

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: Get underneath the jet! The cases will slide over!

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: Lower! Get underneath it!

Speaker: kristel
Dialogue: It's dragging us down! Disconnect the cable!

Speaker: kristel
Dialogue: So much for phase one.  Now what?

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: Now -- we call the police.

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Look -- I know there's a storm, but that wasn't thunder.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Hal, when you've been in this line as long as I have --

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Rocky Mountain Rescue -- come in, mayday --

Speaker: kristel
Dialogue: Downed charter flight alpha-charlie-niner--  -- dead, seven seriously wounded, acknowledge --

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Acknowledged, mayday. What's your position?

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Got to be Comb Bluff.  Acknowledged, mayday. Winds are too strong for us to get a copter up there -- can you and your passengers make it through the storm? Over --

Speaker: kristel (o.s.
Dialogue: Negative -- cockpit is on fire -- fuselage broken into three sep--  --ed in shock.  Need medical supplies, including insulin, repeat, insulin, as soon as po --

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Mayday -- come in, mayday --

Speaker: qualen
Dialogue: Not bad. The insulin was a nice touch.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Maggie?

Speaker: maggie
Dialogue: Hey there --

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Hi.  Could you introduce us?

Speaker: maggie
Dialogue: Sure. Gabe Walker -- this is A27. A27 -- Gabe.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Not the tag -- what do you call him?

Speaker: maggie
Dialogue: Her. I call her Lucky.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Bastards...

Speaker: maggie
Dialogue: They got the mother -- and left this one behind. Too small to make a decent trophy, I guess.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: About four months, right?  Christ -- it must have been just about his -- I mean her -- first flight --

Speaker: maggie
Dialogue: Time to change the dressing.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: You can't do that alone --

Speaker: maggie
Dialogue: I've had to learn. She trust me --

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: I'm making her nervous --  You hold her, I'll do the dressing.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Got some fight in her -- that's good.  What happened to Dave?

Speaker: maggie
Dialogue: The usual. Flew off -- never calls, never writes --

Speaker: maggie
Dialogue: I'm glad to see you, Gabe. But I kind of wish you hadn't come. I was almost used to you being gone.  Why are you here?

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: I didn't realize it till I saw you at the airport. But I came back for you, Maggie.

Speaker: maggie
Dialogue: Does that mean you're going to stay?

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: No. Not here.  I want you come with me. Start over, somewhere else.

Speaker: maggie
Dialogue: You don't live here any more, Gabe. Your choice, remember? But this is my home. I'm not leaving. You can stay with me, or you can go alone. It's still your choice.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: What the hell do you want?

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: I need your help. A plane's gone down on Comb Bluff. This storm would blow a copter all over the place -- but we can climb up to it.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: "We"?  Talk to somebody who's still on the payroll. You've got a half dozen new guys --

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: -- who couldn't climb that wall now if there were stairs cut into it. But you've soloed it.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: During the summer. On a bet.

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: This is a little more important than a bet. Just a few injured people with no first aid or shelter, camping in a zero degree blizzard. They'll be ice sculptures by tomorrow morning.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Fuck this one up on your own.

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Play it again, Gabe, about how we killed her. I was there too, remember?

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Not like I was, pal -- her fingers brushed mine on the way down --

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: We lost her. Whatever anybody says about cold stress and the clip, you and I have to live with that. But right now, there are some more people who need our help, and they shouldn't die too just because you've got a problem keeping the past in the past.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: I don't want the responsibility.

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Walk away and you are responsible. They'll die. I can't do this alone.  You know what else, Gabe? You can go anywhere you want, but if you don't do this, now, you're going to be stuck on that goddamn ledge for the rest of your life.

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: That thing's dead weight. Completely useless for an ice climb.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Just backup.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: I'll lead. I left a few bolts last time I climbed this -- I think I can find some of them.

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Save the rope for when it gets tough.  That bet was for you to free climb the wall.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Tell you what, Hal -- if we're still alive tomorrow morning, I'll give you the twenty bucks back, okay?

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Anchored!

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Rockslide!

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Anchored!

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: You're sure this time --

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Don't say it --

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: It's kind of hard to resist --

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: Good. Return to the plane and cover your tracks.

Speaker: qualen
Dialogue: Get ready.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Come on -- the hard part's over.

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: That's it.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: I thought the fuselage was broken. That looks pretty cozy.

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: The pilot was hysterical.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Something's wrong here --

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Does this look like a prank to you? Come on --

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Relax -- we're here to help --

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Don't try to talk --

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: Where?

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: -- Where? What are you --

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: You said "we". Where are the rest?

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: What's for dinner?  Try and make this edible.

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: Hal Tucker.  Where's yours?

Speaker: qualen
Dialogue: He doesn't have one. Just a wallet.

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: Gabe Walker...  Very attractive.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: My ex.

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: Too bad. Let me tell you what's on for today. We'd like you to help settle a wager. You see, we lost some luggage --

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: Now tell me -- who wins?

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: Good dog. Now let's get this expedition started.

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: Okay. Connect the dots.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: This way.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: We don't have to do this. We know these mountains -- they don't. If we can get ahead --

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Can you climb faster than they can shoot?

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: We've got to try something. Think we'll get a finder's fee after they get all their "luggage"?

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Sure. All the bullets we can eat.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: That's not what really worries me.

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: There's something else to worry about?

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Yeah. Once they've got what they're after -- they're gonna need a copter to get out of here.

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Maggie.

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: Hold it.  It's up there.

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: Fetch.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: I'll need the ice axe.

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: You've got to be kidding.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Okay. How about some tape?

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Crampons too.

Speaker: qualen
Dialogue: I don't trust him.

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: Where could he go?

Speaker: qualen
Dialogue: I'd rather he didn't show us.  We don't need two guides.

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: You win. Kill him when he gets down.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Jesus.

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: Lower it down -- now!

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: Get him!

Speaker: qualen
Dialogue: Bring the money down, or we kill your friend!

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: We can't.  And he knows it.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Come on --

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: You son of a bitch --

Speaker: qualen
Dialogue: No. We need him to get the rest of the money.  If he dies we lose everything

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: Get us out of here.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: What the hell --

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Brett -- you're not going to believe this -- but a couple of guys are holding a gun on Hal and forcing him up the bluff --

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: What the fuck is going on here?

Speaker: brett
Dialogue: Let's catch up and find out.

Speaker: maggie
Dialogue: Rescue Unit -- what's going on, Hall? -- over --

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: No tricks, no procedural codes, no personal messages -- just tell them everything's under control and you're taking care of the wounded.

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: We've reached the wreckage -- top of Comb Bluff -- six injured, but they're responding to treatment. Everything A-OK. Over.

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Negative, Maggie. Winds are too high, and the passengers' injuries are all superficial. We're going to ride out the storm here -- over --

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: Have her come up.

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Forget it -- downdrafts would wipe her all over the peaks --  -- Not that I expect you to give a shit, but it's our only copter. You'll be stuck.

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Forget about it, Maggie, that's an order -- acknowledge --

Speaker: maggie
Dialogue: Acknowledged. Let me talk to Gabe -- over --

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: -- what?

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: The next one's on top of the peak. This'll be long, but easy -- more like a hike than a climb.

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: It looks like a winding route.

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: There's a more direct route. The East Face. But it's the wall on the other side, and it's smooth as glass. Maybe a dozen guys in the world could do it in good weather. Only a psycho would try it in a snowstorm.

Speaker: wright
Dialogue: Okay -- I know it's not in San Francisco. I know it's not here. I know it's not in any fucking airport from here to Montana. Where it's not - we got that covered. Now, do you have any ideas on where it is?

Speaker: davis
Dialogue: There's no radio contact, sir. At all. We're not receiving the tracer signal from the cockpit's flight recorder. Radar lost it after it went low here.

Speaker: davis
Dialogue: We have to assume it went down in the storm.

Speaker: wright
Dialogue: Air search?

Speaker: davis
Dialogue: That storm hasn't quit yet. Weather service says we've got it until tomorrow morning at least. Even if we could get a plane up now, it'd be impossible to see anything on the ground. And --

Speaker: wright
Dialogue: -- The roads are shut down, right?

Speaker: davis
Dialogue: Most of this area doesn't even have roads.

Speaker: wright
Dialogue: Keep two copters on full standby. And let me know the second that storm starts to wind down.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: A steak soaked with Glenlivet, cooking over a steambath on fire.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Sorry, Gordon -- I promise I'll have it back tomorrow.

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Come on -- tourists take this trail.

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: Is this it?

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Yeah. This is it.

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: Good. Get out of the way.

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: This way.

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: It's over here!

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: He can't be far away -- spread out!

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: Put your hands on your head.

Speaker: qualen
Dialogue: Follow him!

Speaker: kynette
Dialogue: After you.

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Well -- look at the bright side.  At least you've only got to make the split five ways now.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Please still be there -- oh, please --

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Mmm. Just like -- chicken.

Speaker: davis
Dialogue: We've got a fix on the plane, sir -- we're getting a reading on the flight recorder tracer --

Speaker: wright
Dialogue: Any visual? Any radio contact?

Speaker: davis
Dialogue: Not yet --

Speaker: wright
Dialogue: Get the copters ready. We take off in three minutes.

Speaker: davis
Dialogue: The winds are still too strong --

Speaker: wright
Dialogue: Sorry to hear it. We're still going. The plane might be intact.

Speaker: davis
Dialogue: Sir --

Speaker: wright
Dialogue: Shut up. That fifty million isn't coming out of my pension.

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: Still interested in staying alive?

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: It's up here. Somewhere on the Tower. There's a way to cross over to the top in about half a day.

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: Show me.

Speaker: brett
Dialogue: I'll cut around this side, and wind up in front. You come up behind them -- quietly. And we've got 'em.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: Brett -- they've got five guns --

Speaker: brett
Dialogue: And you can collect them all after I get the drop on 'em. Let's get moving.

Speaker: brett
Dialogue: End of the line!

Speaker: brett
Dialogue: You heard me! Drop the guns!

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: "End of the line"? That's classic.  You've got style. So, I'm going to give you a three-count to figure out how to turn the safety off.

Speaker: brett
Dialogue: Nice try. I've got one of these at home. Now drop 'em.

Speaker: brett
Dialogue: Hey -- where's the other guy --

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Brett, behind you!

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: Time to --

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: What are we going to do --

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: You came up here to jump the spur --  This'd be a great time to do it.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: But --

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Listen -- they don't know you're up here -- I'll draw their fire, you've got to make the jump and get help.

Speaker: evan
Dialogue: I don't -- I -- uh --

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Unless you want to do it the other way around?

Speaker: kristel
Dialogue: Stop!

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Come on -- wait till you're out of range -- don't pull it yet --

Speaker: qualen
Dialogue: Was that Walker?

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: No such luck.  Cheer up. Everyone should die in a spot this beautiful.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Don't worry. You will.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Maggie -- what are you doing --

Speaker: maggie
Dialogue: I'm going to go nuts if I sit here one more hour.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Still a little breezy out, Mag --

Speaker: maggie
Dialogue: You coming?

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: Forget about it. He's smart, but he's not invisible.

Speaker: wright
Dialogue: What can you confirm?

Speaker: stuart
Dialogue: Well, sir -- it crashed. That, I can confirm.  We've been here just about one hour. These events take months to analyze. So if you'll excuse me --

Speaker: wright
Dialogue: No, I don't think I will. The reason the FAA pays you is to exercise your vast, amazing knowledge of these "events". So I expect you to come up with some stunning insights, something a slow-witted fuck like me hasn't already observed.  And three: the flight recorder's tracer led us here in the first place. So where is the goddamn thing? That one's got me all aflush with curiosity.

Speaker: stuart
Dialogue: You'll be the first to know.

Speaker: wright
Dialogue: Oh, I believe you.

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: I thought you said there was an easy way across.

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: There is. You might not like it much.

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Of course -- we'll have to do it hand over hand. Seems I forgot my harness. Sorry.

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: Don't be. Lead on.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: I didn't need to see that. I really didn't.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Got 'em -- they're under the trees --

Speaker: maggie
Dialogue: Hal! Gabe!

Speaker: maggie
Dialogue: It's Evan.  Parachute failed.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Damn fool. Why would anybody try that in the middle of a storm.

Speaker: maggie
Dialogue: Why would anybody try at all.  Get the bag.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Should've taken that left turn at Albequerque.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: It's just like any other side move -- you can't see where the fuck you're going, that's all --

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Much better.

Speaker: maggie
Dialogue: Bring it down here.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Maggie --

Speaker: maggie
Dialogue: Just do it, Frank.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Maggie, this is dumb --

Speaker: maggie
Dialogue: No it isn't. I'm going to find Brett -- I don't want to have to talk to his widow too. Fly Evan's body back to base -- I'll call you when I've found Brett. Or Hal. Or Gabe. Or anybody.

Speaker: kynette
Dialogue: I'm going back.

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: Look -- this part is nothing, believe me --

Speaker: kynette
Dialogue: Walker should be coming up by now.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: So much for the easy part.

Speaker: kynette
Dialogue: He's on the way up. I could hear that jacket before I could see it.

Speaker: kynette
Dialogue: I'll wait till he comes to me.

Speaker: kynette
Dialogue: Bulletin. The climber isn't Walker -- it's a woman.

Speaker: kynette
Dialogue: Rotten weather for a climb, huh?  I have two questions I'd like to trouble you with. Ready?

Speaker: kynette
Dialogue: This first one's easy. Do you know a man named Gabe Walker?

Speaker: maggie
Dialogue: Yes.  Where is he?

Speaker: kynette
Dialogue: You don't know either? I am sorry. That was question number two.  Thanks for your time.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Come on --

Speaker: maggie
Dialogue: Where? --

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Here.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Today, goddamit!

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: This way.  I like the outside of the mountain better too, but --

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Stop.

Speaker: maggie
Dialogue: We can't --

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: I need to stop.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: I'm glad to see you -- but Christ, I wish you hadn't come.

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: Don't tell me --

Speaker: qualen
Dialogue: He's still alive.

Speaker: qualen
Dialogue: For another two minutes.

Speaker: maggie
Dialogue: It hurts just looking at you.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Try it from this side. Do you still have your radio?

Speaker: maggie
Dialogue: It's not going to work in here.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Let's give it a try.  Come in, Rescue Unit --

Speaker: qualen
Dialogue: Patience.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Is there anybody else on the radio?

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: I take a year off and the department goes to hell.  -- Come in, Rescue Unit --

Speaker: qualen
Dialogue: Try to get thirty million in entertainment out of this, because he is definitely in for thirty million worth of pain.

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: You sick fuck --

Speaker: qualen
Dialogue: Don't worry. They may still be alive. That was the small one.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Jesus -- that's some flare.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Are you all right?

Speaker: maggie
Dialogue: Why are they doing this?

Speaker: maggie
Dialogue: We might be able to get up that way -- there's an opening --

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: No -- there could be another bomb up there -- even if there isn't, we could get another cave-in. The only sure way out is through the side.

Speaker: davis
Dialogue: I've got something here.

Speaker: stuart
Dialogue: Let's have it.

Speaker: davis
Dialogue: There's an unconfirmed report of a distress call made from a plane that crashed.

Speaker: stuart
Dialogue: That's really, really interesting, but --  -- kind of old news, don't you think?

Speaker: davis
Dialogue: This call was supposedly made from a plane that crash landed. After it landed.

Speaker: stuart
Dialogue: Sounds like they got it wrong. Next time you interrupt my work make sure it's something I can use.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Come on -- we're almost out.

Speaker: kynette
Dialogue: Miss me?

Speaker: qualen
Dialogue: You might say a few words for your friends -- this is the one that will bury them.

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: What happened?

Speaker: qualen
Dialogue: I'm not sure -- I set the timer --

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Gabe, it's a dud --

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Move!

Speaker: qualen
Dialogue: When I was seventeen, I was a sentry on the East Berlin boundary. There was a problem, then -- too many defectors were managing to sneak through the wilderness to the west. A man would take them through, every night of every week -- a man like your friend.  They pulled eight bodies out of the tunnel, and I was promoted to intelligence the next day.

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: Thanks. We couldn't have killed him without you.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Knock this in the side. Make it firm.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Maggie -- come in, Maggie, this is Rescue One --

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: There's our ride out of here. Everyone out of sight -- except you, Kristel.  Make the distress call. You're so good at it.

Speaker: maggie
Dialogue: What are we going to do?

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Die. I'm sorry, Maggie. I'm sorry you got into this.

Speaker: maggie
Dialogue: What are you doing?

Speaker: wright
Dialogue: He didn't think a distress call from a crashed plane was "important"?  Get me a fucking radio! Now!

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Come in, Maggie, over --

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: I copy, Charlie Niner -- what's your position -- over --

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Sit tight, Charlie Niner -- I'm right on top of you.

Speaker: maggie
Dialogue: Frank! Down here! Frank!

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Forget about it. He can't hear you.  Tie these together. Tight.

Speaker: maggie
Dialogue: -- Are you out of your mind --

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: This is rope from the Gordon exhibit. The way guys climbed then, they'd tie on three at a time -- this rope'll take around nine hundred pounds.

Speaker: maggie
Dialogue: Gabe -- this rope is sixty years old --

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Yeah, they made it pretty good then. Each of these strands ought to hold about 300 pounds before snapping.

Speaker: maggie
Dialogue: Will it hold?

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Depends on how big a breakfast you had. You want to go first?

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Swing towards it -- and drop!

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: What the fuck --

Speaker: kristel
Dialogue: What -- who are --

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Don't worry. I'm here to help.

Speaker: kristel
Dialogue: Glad to hear it.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Jailhouse load. First chamber's empty --  -- the rest aren't. Forgive me, but things have been a little strange this morning.

Speaker: traver
Dialogue: Stop!  You'll damage the helicopter.

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: Answer that.

Speaker: kristel
Dialogue: Rocky Mountain Rescue One, over --

Speaker: stuart
Dialogue: This is Ross Stuart, Federal Aviation Administration -- please identify -- over --

Speaker: kristel
Dialogue: Copy, FAA. This is Margaret Deighan, Rocky Mountain Rescue. Over --

Speaker: kristel
Dialogue: Copy, FAA. Distress call came at approximately eleven hundred hours yesterday. I investigated -- the call turned out to be a false alarm. Over.

Speaker: stuart
Dialogue: Please repeat, Rocky Mountain Rescue -- distress call was a false alarm? -- over --

Speaker: stuart
Dialogue: Not from you. Thanks, Rocky Mountain Rescue -- over and out --

Speaker: stuart
Dialogue: I don't want to say I told you so. But I did. Can I go back to work now?

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: I almost believed you myself.

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Goodbye, Frank.

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: Time for number three. Unless you want to have a longer conversation with him elsewhere.

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Fuck off.

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: I think I'll wait here. You just murdered three of my friends. Sooner or later, whoever's chasing you is going to show up and return the favor, and I'd love to watch.

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: Suit yourself. You see, we just had a little interface with several branches of the federal government -- one of whose members I know has zero imagination -- and I can tell you, the cavalry just isn't going to make it by this week.  Am I right?

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Are you okay?

Speaker: maggie
Dialogue: My ears are ringing -- but I'm all right. Gabe, what's going on?

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: This. That plane crash -- it's a half dozen guys who were smart enough to steal fifty million bucks, but dumb enough to drop it all over the range. They've got Hal as a bird dog -- and right now they're heading for the rest of it.

Speaker: maggie
Dialogue: Where?

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: It's close to the lake -- Hal's probably leading them on the slowest possible route down to it.  I can get there first -- all I have to do is make it along the north wall to the Bitker ladder --

Speaker: maggie
Dialogue: "All?" Jesus, Gabe -- what do you expect to do then?

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Something -- subtle.

Speaker: maggie
Dialogue: I'm going with you.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: No way. You're climbing back down -- try to get to the station or find some help.

Speaker: maggie
Dialogue: I'm just as good a climber as you are -- and right now, I'm definitely in better shape.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: And you're definitely not going --

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Okay. Come on --

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: -- but the second you slow me down, I'm leaving --  -- I'm leaving you behind. Understood?

Speaker: maggie
Dialogue: Anything you say, Gabe.

Speaker: davis
Dialogue: We've tested the ash inside -- it's the right paper.

Speaker: wright
Dialogue: What about the men?

Speaker: davis
Dialogue: It's -- hard to tell. But forensics says yes. All of them were in the plane.

Speaker: wright
Dialogue: Especially a guy like Travers.

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: Qualen. How far along are you?

Speaker: qualen
Dialogue: It looks like two miles, but --

Speaker: qualen
Dialogue: -- it'll take some time.

Speaker: qualen
Dialogue: What about him?

Speaker: qualen
Dialogue: Agreed.

Speaker: maggie
Dialogue: Gabe?  I'll go first.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: If I don't go first, I might not go at all.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Think you can beat my time?

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Shit -- she is in better shape.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Quit sandbagging it -- I haven't got all day --

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: That -- tears it.  You're not coming any further.

Speaker: maggie
Dialogue: Gabe -- you're going to get yourself killed --

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Look, Maggie. I don't know what'll happen when I catch up with Hal -- but I've got to know one thing for sure -- that you're making it off this mountain. Alive.

Speaker: maggie
Dialogue: Okay.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Get on the trail and stay out of sight.  I'll see you on the ground.

Speaker: wright
Dialogue: I give up. What was it?

Speaker: search pilot
Dialogue: ID says this used to be your pilot.  And we found him seven miles east of the wreck.

Speaker: wright
Dialogue: A hijack.  The plane was hijacked. Son of a bitch --

Speaker: stuart
Dialogue: Oh, give me a break. Your pilot lost it when the flight started going south, and he bailed --

Speaker: search pilot
Dialogue: Excuse me -- but there's no parachute there. Check it yourself.

Speaker: forensics agent
Dialogue: Sir -- we found the flight recorder -- it was driven twenty feet deep into a crater. It was demolished, but we salvaged the recording --

Speaker: stuart
Dialogue: I've heard a thousand of these, Wright -- whoever was at the stick is going to begin by screeching the Lord's Prayer and wind up screaming "Oh, shit" at ground zero --

Speaker: wright
Dialogue: Guess we're both right, Stuart. Thanks for your expertise.  You'll be waiting till Groundhog's Day for him to pull his head out of his ass -- let's get it in the air!

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Hasn't gotten any lower in the last year.  Bitker, you cheap bastard. Would another four feet have killed you?

Speaker: qualen
Dialogue: Almost there.

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Oh, no -- you didn't lose another one, did you?

Speaker: delmer
Dialogue: What about him?

Speaker: qualen
Dialogue: Kill him! Now!

Speaker: delmer
Dialogue: Tell me -- where would you like the first half dozen shots to go?

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: As long as you're taking requests -- how about -- the base of your spine?

Speaker: qualen
Dialogue: Travers. Get down here. Now.

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: Have you found the money?

Speaker: kristel
Dialogue: You would have lived longer, if you weren't such a smartass.

Speaker: kristel
Dialogue: You telegraphed this kind of stunt with that joke snowman. Too bad for you we're not all gullible.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Good thing for Qualen you are.

Speaker: kristel
Dialogue: What do you mean?

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: When he comes back, he's going to shoot you and the other guy, grab the money, and take off with Travers.

Speaker: kristel
Dialogue: No sale. Say "night-night" --

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Am I wrong? Give him a buzz.

Speaker: kristel
Dialogue: You've got my attention.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: You've also got all the money. And I can show you how to get off the mountain with it. Right now.

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: He's hiding twenty yards in -- be careful.

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: He's right behind you!

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: Something's moving fast down the hill -- is it Tucker?

Speaker: kristel
Dialogue: How much further?

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: It's right over there.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: It's a storage locker for the rangers. Everything you need to get off the mountain is in there -- skiis, food -- I'll show you --

Speaker: kristel
Dialogue: Don't move.

Speaker: kristel
Dialogue: Skiis, food -- and maybe guns too, right?  Keep walking. Not too close.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: We'd make better time walking straight ahead. Qualen's not going to be hopping down the bunny trail too much longer.

Speaker: kristel
Dialogue: Right. So I'd better have one less problem when he arrives.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Don't fuck up. You still need me to show you a route off the mountain.

Speaker: kristel
Dialogue: You've worn that one out, Walker --  -- I'll find my own way down.

Speaker: maggie
Dialogue: Frank! Down here!

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: Hop in. I know someone who'd like to see you again before he dies.

Speaker: qualen
Dialogue: If you were smart, you'd have left your friend behind. I would have. There's no shame in staying alive.

Speaker: qualen
Dialogue: But you're not smart. And now you're going to die from an overdose of heroism.

Speaker: qualen
Dialogue: Stalemate, isn't it?

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Not any more.

Speaker: qualen
Dialogue: Far more intimidating when it's loaded.

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: I know you never liked the orange, but --

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Didn't care for the Smokey The Bear hats, either. That's why I quit.  You all right?

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: I feel better than you look. I can live with that.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Hardly seems worth zipping, huh?  Frank?

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: It's not over, Gabe. Travers took the helicopter.

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: Qualen -- Kristel -- come in --

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: May I?  Any messages?

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Maggie --

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: You wanted to make a trade earlier, Walker -- still interested?

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Now what?

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: I have no fucking idea.  Empty.

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Not for long.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Why can't anything be easy?

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Stay over there --

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Look -- let me --

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: -- what, throw snowballs at him? Just -- whatever happens -- get Maggie out of here.

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: And Gabe? Thanks for tagging along.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Thanks for asking. I forgot how much I enjoyed rescue work.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: You won.

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: I'll kill her --

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: No rush. I'm sure you've got lots of time.

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: All right. Drop the gun first.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: When she's safe on the ground.

Speaker: travers
Dialogue: Get out.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Run!

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Now come and get it. My arm's getting tired.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Don't you want to count it?

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Don't spend it all in one place, you son of a bitch.

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: He's going to run Gabe down --

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Cheer up. It's a beautiful spot to die.

Speaker: wright
Dialogue: I'm no expert -- but what do you make of that "event"?

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Forget it. No fucking way. I'm staying right here. I've spent the night on walls before -- some of the best nights of my life have been spent lashed to walls --

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Remember -- keep your arms and legs in the vehicle at all times --

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Fuck you --

Speaker: hal
Dialogue: Jesus Christ -- you think you could have put a little less effort into that climb? I mean, what have you done for me -- lately?

Speaker: maggie
Dialogue: Does this mean you're staying?
